metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38177 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.19+esm7
